name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Jacksonville

reviews.text: Location is great, near highway and plenty of restaurants.
reviews.title: Attentive, helpful staff - top Hilton property!

reviews.text: Property is well maintained. Staff very helpful, attentive, dedicated to making your stay better. Suites are very roomy - we were in a 2 bedroom suite for my husband, me and daughter. Plenty of room for everyone to have their own space.
reviews.title: Will not be back

reviews.text: We moved here from a nearby Marriott property (had problems there) - the staff at Homewood did a great job finding us a comparable set up and even worked with us on the rate.
reviews.title: Not as nice as it used to be

reviews.text: The outdoor pool is not heated (even in FL, this means the water is COLD in April). The spa was nice, but only worked for about 15 minutes, then it quit. The maintenance man wasn't able to repair it at that time, but early the next day it was working fine. He made sure we knew he would take care of it and apologized for it affecting our stay.
reviews.title: Perfect for a stay on the way

reviews.text: Breakfast is good (plenty of choices, including eggs and meat, not just continental stuff) and they also have weekday "dinners" including wine and beer.
reviews.title: Horrible Staff Service

reviews.text: Okay, I will admit I was torn between a 3 and 4 star rating for this hotel and in other circumstances I might give it a 3. We considered the Homewood Suites - Jacksonville South and came here solely based on price. I brought my family here to keep me company on a business trip and spend a long weekend. It turned out the hotel was about a block from my client which was great, and 3 miles from a very nice indoor mall (Avenues) where they could hang out while I was meeting for a couple of hours.
reviews.title: Worked for us but is getting run down

reviews.text: On the upside, the staff has been really great. We paid for a 2-bedroom one night and used points for the other two. They kept us in the same room even though a reward redemption is technically only for a 1-bedroom. Breakfast was good and dinners, while not impressive, were free and free is good. The location is really solid relative to shopping, food, freeway and a lot of businesses. There are driveways both onto the main street and a sidestreet with a traffic light to turn left onto the main street which sounds trivial until you have to spend an hour trying to turn left. Our room could have been cleaner and better maintained, especially the carpets, but overall was fine. Cable channels were great for us. Even though it is on a main street, our room (231) was plenty quiet.
reviews.title: We would book this hotel again!

reviews.text: I spend over 100 nights/year in hotels so here's my downside critique. I'm disappointed that many of the things people wrote about in reviews 2 years ago are still present. The onsite pond with fountain was completely algaed over. The property itself is in need of a lot of maintenance. I did not think the bed (or any other furnature) was particularly comfortable. Internet is wired rather than wireless and only in the living room. Kitchen does not have an oven (which is only bad because there is a Pepperidge Farm outlet very close and it would have been great to eat turnovers). The grounds are clearly being worked on but could use a lot more. Lots of weeds where there should be plants, mulch missing, plants that should be pruned, etc.
reviews.title: Homewood Suites was Great
basic hotel - need to be updated
reviews.text: As I said, for us this worked well. Since the new Homewood Suites was $70/night more, I would stay here again if paying with my own money. If I was using points or company money, I would probably try the new one.

reviews.title: Not Hilton Quality
reviews.text: As grandparents traveling with our daughter, son-in-law & our 6 grandchildren ages 2-12, we found it almost impossible to find overnight accommodations that would allow 5 persons to a room. The Homewood was one of the few exceptions. We booked two suites each with one bedroom (with 2 double beds) and a pull-out couch. We were very please with our rooms that were very clean! The complimentary breakfast was fantastic - scrambled eggs, fresh waffles, sausage, bacon, cereal, muffins, juice, etc. All the children found their favorites! When you have 10 people to feed a nourishing breakfast at a restaurant, it really adds up! (The large "restaurant style" room was very homey and inviting.) We did not use the other facilities (pool, etc.) as we were out sightseeing all day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had requested both rooms non-smoking. We obviously received one that previously was a smoking room & when we mentioned this at check-out, we were given a "very generous" reduction in our bill! We felt more than compensated. We were also able to use our senior discount to book both rooms at a savings! Our only complaint would be the "size" of the parking spots (free!) which were extremely tight & difficult to exit/enter the vehicle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good. The staff is very willing to help. They are all very nice and I think go out of their way to honor requests. Saying that...
reviews.title: Not up to Hilton Standards!!

reviews.text: The Bad. The Hotel is not even a "hotel" per say. It is OLD Quad Apartments that someone purchased, repainted and installed some granite counter tops. Other than that, the apartments show their age (at LEAST 30 years old). All rooms have old outdoor access and rooms on the second floor ONLY have stairs, no elevators!! Doors are old and have 1/2 inch gap (see pic). OLD appliances (see pic). Water stained and damaged ceiling (see pic). While I was taking the pic of the ceiling, like "on cue" a bug walked into the pic.
reviews.title: Great service, even better rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We entered our (requested, before we knew there were no elevators) second floor room and smelled a VERY strong chemical odor almost like dry cleaning fluid. Gave me a headache! Air conditioner was not cooling room (A/C is also 30+ years old) contacted front desk and they promptly sent maintenance. It started to cool within an hour. We were in the second quad building and had major road noise.
reviews.title: Homewood Suites Baymeadows

reviews.text: To be very fare, we got a great rate due to a Hilton promotion. If we would have paid full price for the room I would have been VERY upset! We made reservations for 2 days but checked out after just one. I have NO IDEA where the 4-5 Star reviewers stay normally, but to rate this hotel at 4-5 stars is down right ridiculous!
reviews.title: Good Bargain

reviews.text: I didn't read (which we ALWAYS do) the reviews for this hotel before we made the reservations! We were on the road and had stayed at Homewood Suites before and had always been happy with our selection. I will NEVER make that mistake again!
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.text: Don't judge a book by its cover. This is another 90s era built Homewood and from the outside it may disappoint at first. The property is made up of several separate buildings, some with outdoor room entrances from outdoor stairways with three stories and some buildings with unified hallway entrances to the rooms. I stayed in the latter. The hallway condition also gave an impression of 1990 with what smelled and looked like old moldy carpet but once inside the room and its a complete paradigm shift. The rooms have new carpet, marble counters, flat screens, large comfortable beds and other appointments. The bathroom was of equal quality nice too. One note, the microwave looked like it came from the 90s too. Without an auto rotating inner cooking surface it's ancientness almost kills the rest of the room. Almost.
reviews.title: A review from your extended stay business traveler.

reviews.text: The outdoor grounds are a mixed bag. The front "lodge", for meals and check-ins is nice. The outdoor pool is good too. Near the lodge is a nice gazebo to stop by and relax after a meal. But the property also has a fenced off large square pond smack between two major buildings with floating algae and a spurting fountain that looks like it's working only half way. This has to be an eye sore to the owner and management of this hotel.
reviews.title: Decent Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast and evening meals offer good variety and are hosted well. The property also has an outstanding cable TV line up.
reviews.title: Purse and laptop stolen from locked room

reviews.text: So to sum it up this hotel gets it right in what is to me are the most important features, the room, meals and most of the property. For extended stay type hotels Jacksonville doesn't offer a lot of ultra new choices. Especially in the suburbs away from the beach.
reviews.title: Terrible stay at a brand that I truely believed in...

reviews.text: For first time stays be advised the southern edge of this hotel and its lobby borders right along the major street it is against. if you are driving from the east you could drive right past it because of it's small sign. If you miss the almost hidden entrance from the east you have to drive the length of the hotel north for its second only entrance and then drive back south to it's front .
reviews.title: Walls are paper thin; nice staff

aka: Homewood Suites By Hilton Jacksonville Hotel
description: Welcome to the Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham located in the Baymeadows area. Come experience our 116 condominium-style suites offering one and two bedroom suites. Our suite come with a separate sleeping area and a living area with a sofa bed. Enjoy the convenience of being able to cook a meal in the fully equipped kitchen providing a stove, refrigerator, dishwasher and microwave. We have hot buffet breakfast 7 days a week and a light dinner Monday - Thursday. Enjoy your favorite cable television show on any of the two, 36 inch flat screen TVs. Our extended stay hotel is near businesses such as Citibank, Bank of America, Blue Cross, Blue Shield, Convergys, State Farm, GE Aviation and JP Morgan Chase. Play a game of basketball on our sports court or come work out in our fitness center and take a dip in our outdoor pool and hot tub. Whatever you enjoy, we look forward to having you as our guest. We are a pet friendly property, $50.00 fee.
